com.samysadi.acs.virtualization

Class VirtualMachineDefault

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.samysadi.acs.core.notifications.NotifierImpl
      • com.samysadi.acs.core.tracing.ProbedImpl
        • com.samysadi.acs.core.entity.EntityImpl
          • com.samysadi.acs.core.entity.RunnableEntityImpl
            • com.samysadi.acs.virtualization.VirtualMachineDefault
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Entity, RunnableEntity, Notifier, Probed, VirtualMachine, Cloneable
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    TemporaryVirtualMachineDefault, ThinClientVirtualMachineDefault

    public class VirtualMachineDefault
extends RunnableEntityImpl
implements VirtualMachine
    This implementation will only set parent for its VirtualRam when it is started.
    Since:
    1.0

      • setParent

        public void setParent(Entity parent)
        Description copied from interface: Entity
        Updates the parent of this entity.
        This method makes sure that the old and the new parent keep their entities list updated, by automatically calling Entity.addEntity(Entity) and Entity.removeEntity(Entity).

        A CoreNotificationCodes.ENTITY_PARENT_CHANGED notification is thrown.
        Additionally, each descendant of this entity (ie: entities who have this entity as their direct or not direct parent) are notified using CoreNotificationCodes.ENTITY_ANCESTOR_CHANGED.

        Specified by:
        setParent in interface Entity
        Specified by:
        setParent in interface VirtualMachine
        Overrides:
        setParent in class RunnableEntityImpl
        See Also:
        RunnableEntity.unplace()

      • doCancel

        public void doCancel()
        Description copied from interface: RunnableEntity
        Stops the entity's activity and declares it as canceled.

        If this entity owns RunnableEntity children, then they must also be canceled.

        Nothing is done if this entity is already terminated (if RunnableEntity.isTerminated() returns true).

        Specified by:
        doCancel in interface RunnableEntity

      • doFail

        public void doFail()
        Description copied from interface: RunnableEntity
        Stops the entity's activity and declares it as failed.

        If this entity owns RunnableEntity children, then they must also be declared as failed.

        Nothing is done if this entity is already terminated (if RunnableEntity.isTerminated() returns true).

        Specified by:
        doFail in interface RunnableEntity

        Specified by:

      • doRestart

        public void doRestart()
        Description copied from interface: RunnableEntity
        Reinitializes the entity and restarts it from the beginning.

        Use this method to start again an entity after it is terminated. So, unlike RunnableEntity.doStart() this method will not throw an exception if this entity is already terminated.

        Make sure that RunnableEntity.canRestart() returns true before calling this method or you will get an exception.

        If this entity owns RunnableEntity children, then they must be canceled.

        Specified by:
        doRestart in interface RunnableEntity

      • doStart

        public void doStart()
        Description copied from interface: RunnableEntity
        Starts or continues the entity's activity and declares it as running.

        Make sure that RunnableEntity.canStart() returns true before calling this method or you will get an exception.

        If this entity owns RunnableEntity children, then they must also be started.

        Specified by:
        doStart in interface RunnableEntity

      • doTerminate

        public void doTerminate()
        Will cancel the VM, or will declare it as completed if all its jobs are terminated.
        Specified by:
        doTerminate in interface RunnableEntity

        This does not update the parent of the given entity.

      • removeEntity

        public void removeEntity(Entity entity)
        Description copied from interface: Entity
        Search for the given children entity and removes it.
        This does not update the parent property of the entity.

        Note: You should not need to call this method, instead use EntityImpl.setParent(Entity) with null parameter.

        Specified by:

        Overrides:

      • getComputingProvisioner

        public ComputingProvisioner getComputingProvisioner()
        Description copied from interface: VirtualMachine
        Returns the ComputingProvisioner for computing operations at this virtual machine level, or null if none is set.

        A ComputingProvisioner is not mandatory for VMs. It should be used only if you want to set specific MIPS limits for this particular VM. So, for example, you can set a maximum allowable MIPS for all operations inside this VM. You can also allow specific Jobs to have more MIPS than others.

        null can be returned if there is no need for special strategy at this VM level.

        Specified by:
        getComputingProvisioner in interface VirtualMachine
        Returns:
        this virtual machine's computing provisioner or null if no computing provisioner was set

      • getStorageProvisioner

        public StorageProvisioner getStorageProvisioner()
        Description copied from interface: VirtualMachine
        Returns the StorageProvisioner for storage operations at this virtual machine level, or null if none is set.

        A StorageProvisioner is not mandatory for VMs. It should be used only if you want to set specific transfer rate limits for this particular VM. So, for example, you can set a maximum allowable transfer rate for all operations inside this VM. You can also allow specific Jobs to have more transfer rate than others.

        null can be returned if there is no need for special strategy at this VM level.

        Specified by:
        getStorageProvisioner in interface VirtualMachine
        Returns:
        this virtual machine's storage provisioner or null if no storage provisioner was set

      • getNetworkProvisioner

        public NetworkProvisioner getNetworkProvisioner()
        Description copied from interface: VirtualMachine
        Returns the NetworkProvisioner for network operations at this virtual machine level, or null if none is set.

        A NetworkProvisioner is not mandatory for VMs. It should be used only if you want to set specific BW limits for this particular VM. So, for example, you can set a maximum allowable BW for all operations inside this VM. You can also allow specific Jobs to have more BW than others.

        null can be returned if there is no need for special strategy at this VM level.

        Specified by:
        getNetworkProvisioner in interface VirtualMachine
        Returns:
        this virtual machine's network provisioner or null if no network provisioner was set

      • getPuAllocator

        public PuAllocator getPuAllocator()
        Description copied from interface: VirtualMachine
        Returns the PuAllocator associated with this VM.
        Specified by:
        getPuAllocator in interface VirtualMachine
        Returns:
        the PuAllocator associated with this VM

      • getUsableProcessingUnits

        public List<ProcessingUnit> getUsableProcessingUnits()
        Description copied from interface: VirtualMachine
        Returns the processing units that this VM can use.

        Default is set so that all processing units on the parent host are usable.

        Specified by:
        getUsableProcessingUnits in interface VirtualMachine
        Returns:
        the processing units that this VM can use

      • setUsableProcessingUnits

        public void setUsableProcessingUnits(List<ProcessingUnit> processingUnits,
                            boolean allocatePu)
        Description copied from interface: VirtualMachine
        Updates the processing units that this VM can use.

        If allocatePu parameter is true, then this method will also update the allocated flag for each of the processing units in the given list. And, if one of the given processing units is already allocated then an exception is thrown.

        If null is given then this VM is allowed to use any processing unit in the parent host, even if it is allocated for another VM and independently from the allocatePu parameter.

        Specified by:
        setUsableProcessingUnits in interface VirtualMachine
        Parameters:
        processingUnits - usable processing units, or to null to let this vm use any processing unit on the parent host

      • setUsableProcessingUnits

        public final void setUsableProcessingUnits(List<ProcessingUnit> processingUnits)
        Description copied from interface: VirtualMachine
        Same as VirtualMachine.setUsableProcessingUnits(List, boolean) with the allocatePu parameter set to true.
        Specified by:
        setUsableProcessingUnits in interface VirtualMachine

      • getUsableNetworkInterfaces

        public List<NetworkInterface> getUsableNetworkInterfaces()
        Description copied from interface: VirtualMachine
        Returns the network interfaces that this virtual machine is allowed to use.

        Default is set so that all interfaces on the parent host are usable.

        Specified by:
        getUsableNetworkInterfaces in interface VirtualMachine
        Returns:
        the network interfaces that this virtual machine is allowed to use

      • setUsableNetworkInterfaces

        public void setUsableNetworkInterfaces(List<NetworkInterface> networkInterfaces)
        Description copied from interface: VirtualMachine
        Updates the network interfaces that this virtual machine is allowed to use.

        If null is given then this VM is allowed to use any network interface in the parent host.

        Specified by:
        setUsableNetworkInterfaces in interface VirtualMachine
        Parameters:
        networkInterfaces - usable network interfaces, set to null to let this vm use any network interface on the parent host.

      • setPlacementPolicy

        public void setPlacementPolicy(VmPlacementPolicy policy)
        Description copied from interface: VirtualMachine
        This method is called by VmPlacementPolicy when placing this VM on a host.

        You should not need to call this method if you are not implementing a placement policy.

        Specified by:
        setPlacementPolicy in interface VirtualMachine

      • unplace

        public void unplace()
        Description copied from interface: RunnableEntity
        Takes all actions to unplace this entity using the appropriate placement strategy if any, then sets the null parent to this entity.

        Because this may take time, you need to listen to CoreNotificationCodes.ENTITY_PARENT_CHANGED to know when all actions have been taken.

        If you only want to set a null parent for this entity then use Entity.setParent(Entity). Which will set the null parent immediately.

        Specified by:
        unplace in interface RunnableEntity
        Overrides:
        unplace in class RunnableEntityImpl

      • setNetworkOperationDelayer

        public void setNetworkOperationDelayer(NetworkOperationDelayer operationDelayer)
        Description copied from interface: VirtualMachine
        Sets the current NetworkOperationDelayer for network operations in this VM.

        If the VM is running, then the VM is first paused, then the NetworkOperationDelayer is set, and finally the VM is resumed.

        Specified by:
        setNetworkOperationDelayer in interface VirtualMachine
